passages.text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
passages.context: The fundamental Stoic insight: we control our responses, not circumstances. Freedom lives in the gap between stimulus and response.

passages.text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
passages.context: Philosophy without practice is empty. The point isn't to define goodness but to embody it.

passages.text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
passages.context: Mental hygiene matters more than circumstance. What you think shapes what you experience.

passages.text: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
passages.context: Future-worry is borrowing trouble. The same capacities that serve you now will serve you then.

passages.text: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
passages.context: Popular opinion is no guide to truth. Independent thought matters more than consensus.

passages.text: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
passages.context: Anger often damages more than the original offense. The cure can be worse than the disease.

passages.text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive — to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
passages.context: Existence itself is the gift. Everything else is bonus.

passages.text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
passages.context: Death is inevitable; unlived life is the real tragedy. The question isn't how long, but how fully.

passages.text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
passages.context: Habitual thoughts become character. What you think repeatedly, you become.

passages.text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, and do so with all your heart.
passages.context: Amor fati — love of fate. Full acceptance transforms circumstance from obstacle to path.

passages.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
passages.context: External accumulation misses the point. The source of wellbeing is internal.

passages.text: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.
passages.context: Simple moral compass: right action, true speech. No exceptions, no rationalizations.

passages.text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
passages.context: Don't let others' behavior dictate yours. The true response to wrongdoing is becoming better, not bitter.

passages.text: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
passages.context: The good isn't imported from outside — it's excavated from within. But it requires digging.

passages.text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
passages.context: Epistemic humility: our access to reality is always mediated, always partial.

passages.text: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
passages.context: What we call loss is transformation. Resistance to change is resistance to reality itself.

passages.text: Begin each day by telling yourself: Today I shall be meeting with interference, ingratitude, insolence, disloyalty, ill-will, and selfishness.
passages.context: Negative visualization as inoculation. Expect difficulties and they lose their power to destabilize.

passages.text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
passages.context: Cosmic perspective as medicine for petty concerns. You're part of something vast.

passages.text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
passages.context: The obstacle is the path — difficulties aren't detours but the actual route to growth.

passages.text: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what's left and live it properly.
passages.context: Memento mori as liberation. If you're already dead, every moment is bonus time to be used well.
